body_text.text: Technologies, Rockville, MD) was used in the current work rather than Superscript II. Reverse 48 transcription incubation temperatures were 42°C for 60 min followed by 95°C for 5 min. qPCR 49 was carried out using a Lightcycler 480 (Roche Diagnostics, Mannheim, Germany) in 20-µL 50 reaction volumes. Each reaction was prepared using LightCycler 480 Probes Master reaction 51 mix (Roche Diagnostics), 6 µL of DNA or cDNA template, and target-specific primers and 52 TaqMan probes (Table 2 of main text). Thermocycling began at 95°C for 5 min followed by 45 53 cycles of 10 s at 95°C and 1 min at 60°C. Where m refers to the mass flow rate of manure (g manure/day) and C refers to the concentration 187 of total solids in manure (g total solids/g manure). The subscripts L and S refer to the liquid and 188 solid fractions of separated manure, respectively. Average measurements of C, C L , and C S for the separators in our study were 0.06, 0.04, 210 and 0.3 g total solids/g manure. These correspond to total solids concentrations of 6%, 4%, and 211 30%, respectively, and they represent biweekly measurements on all nine separators between Thus, on average, 92% of the unseparated manure entering these separators exits in the 215 liquid fraction, and -using Equation 4 to find f S -the other 8% exits in the solid fraction.
